SEARCH
Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller

Klasse Controller

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.Controller
Bekannte direkte Unterklassen:
GameController, LeaderboardController, MenuController, UsernameMenuController
public class Controller extends Object
The base controller class that provides common functionality for other controllers in the Minesweeper application.

This class includes utility methods for managing scenes, stages, text elements, and audio playback.

  • Methodendetails

    • initializeStage

      protected void initializeStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage, String style)
      Initializes the given Stage with a specific style.

      This method sets the application icon for the stage based on the provided visual style.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage to be initialized.
      style - The visual style of the game (e.g., "retro", "modern"), used to locate the icon resource.
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - if the resource for the icon cannot be found.

    • switchScene

      protected void switchScene(javafx.stage.Stage stage, javafx.scene.Scene newScene, String title, double newHeight, double newWidth)
      Switches the scene displayed on the specified Stage.

      This method updates the stage to show a new scene, sets the title, adjusts the size if specified, and centers the stage on the screen.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage to update.
      newScene - The new Scene to display on the stage.
      title - The title of the stage window.
      newHeight - The new height of the stage in pixels, or -1 to keep the current height.
      newWidth - The new width of the stage in pixels, or -1 to keep the current width.

    • switchScene

      protected void switchScene(javafx.stage.Stage stage, javafx.scene.Scene newScene, String gameMode, String title)
      Switches the scene displayed on the specified Stage and adjusts the window size based on the game mode.

      This method sets the new scene, calculates the appropriate window dimensions based on the selected game mode (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro"), and updates the stage accordingly.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage to update.
      newScene - The new Scene to display on the stage.
      gameMode - The game mode that determines the size of the window (e.g., "beginner", "advanced", "pro").
      title - The title of the stage window.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid game mode is provided.

    • initializeText

      protected javafx.scene.text.Text initializeText(String id, String msg)
      Creates and initializes a Text element with the specified ID and message.

      This method sets the text content, assigns an ID for identification, and applies a predefined style class to the text element.

      Parameter:
      id - The ID to assign to the text element (used for CSS styling or identification).
      msg - The message to display in the text element.
      Gibt zurück:
      A Text object initialized with the specified properties.

    • playSoundEffect

      protected void playSoundEffect(String fileName, String style)
      Plays a sound effect using the sound effect player.

      This method constructs the file path for the sound effect by appending the file extension .wav to the provided file name, adjusts the volume, and plays the sound effect once using the specified style.

      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the sound effect file (without the extension).
      style - The visual style used to locate the sound effect (e.g., "retro", "modern").

    • playBackgroundMusic

      protected void playBackgroundMusic(String fileName, String style)
      Plays background music using the background music player.

      This method constructs the file path for the music file by appending the file extension .wav to the provided file name, adjusts the volume, and plays the background music in a loop using the specified style.

      Parameter:
      fileName - The name of the background music file (without the extension).
      style - The visual style used to locate the background music (e.g., "retro", "modern").

    • stopBackgroundMusic

      protected void stopBackgroundMusic()
      Stops the background music.

      This method uses the background music player to stop any currently playing music. It is typically called when the background music needs to be paused or replaced.

    • centerStage

      private void centerStage(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Centers the specified Stage on the screen.

      This method calculates the center position of the screen and updates the stage's X and Y coordinates to place it in the center.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage to center on the screen.

    • checkIfInputStreamIsNotNull

      public static void checkIfInputStreamIsNotNull(InputStream inputStream, String fileName) throws FileNotFoundException
      Validates that the provided InputStream is not null.

      This method checks if the given InputStream is null and throws a FileNotFoundException if the file cannot be found or loaded.

      Parameter:
      inputStream - The InputStream to validate.
      fileName - The name of the file associated with the InputStream (used in the exception message).
      Löst aus:
      FileNotFoundException - if the InputStream is null, indicating that the file could not be found.

    • getSoundEffectPlayer

      protected MusicPlayer getSoundEffectPlayer()
      Gets the sound effect player instance.
      Gibt zurück:
      The sound effect MusicPlayer.

    • getBackgroundMusicPlayer

      protected MusicPlayer getBackgroundMusicPlayer()
      Gets the background music player instance.
      Gibt zurück:
      The background music MusicPlayer.
